Serialized Form

  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class MainScreen extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backgroundColour

          java.awt.Color backgroundColour
          this holds the background colour of the main screen

        • lblTodayText

          javax.swing.JLabel lblTodayText
          this is the label that holds the text of the today button

        • lblToday

          javax.swing.JLabel lblToday
          this is the label that holds the bubble image for the today button

        • lblNext7DaysText

          javax.swing.JLabel lblNext7DaysText
          this is the label that holds the text of the next 7 days button

        • lblNext7Days

          javax.swing.JLabel lblNext7Days
          this is the label that holds the bubble image for the next 7 days button

        • lblAllText

          javax.swing.JLabel lblAllText
          this is the label that holds the text of the all button

        • lblAll

          javax.swing.JLabel lblAll
          this is the label that holds the bubble image for the all button

        • lblSettingsText

          javax.swing.JLabel lblSettingsText
          this is the label that holds the text of the settings button

        • lblSettings

          javax.swing.JLabel lblSettings
          this is the label that holds the bubble image for the settings button

        • lblAddTaskText

          javax.swing.JLabel lblAddTaskText
          this is the label that holds the text of the add task button

        • lblAddTask

          javax.swing.JLabel lblAddTask
          this is the label that holds the bubble image for the add task button

        • tasksPanel

          TaskList tasksPanel
          the panel that holds the tasks, it will be switched out as the user clicks the today, next 7 days, and all buttons

        • timeFormat

          int timeFormat
          the formatting of the time which is used in task creator and changed in settings screen

        • settings

          SettingsScreen settings
          the settings screen

        • animation

          javax.swing.Timer animation
          timer to control animations of bubbles

        • animationStatus

          java.lang.String[] animationStatus
          determines whether the animation should happen for the bubble or not. if set to "bubble", the bubble will move. if set to "splash", the bubble will not move. index representations 0 - lblToday 1 - lblNext7Days 2 - lblAll 3 - lblAddTask 4 - lblSettings

        • animationStep

          int[] animationStep
          determines whether each bubble should move up or down. if greater than or equal to 0 or less than or equal to 3, it will move up. if greater than or equal to 4 or less than or equal to 7, it will move down. if it equals 8, the value will be reset to 0. index representations 0 - lblToday 1 - lblNext7Days 2 - lblAll 3 - lblSettings 4 - lblAddTask

        • bubbles

          java.util.ArrayList<E> bubbles
          an arraylist of the button images on the screen, used for the animation

        • bubbleText

          java.util.ArrayList<E> bubbleText
          an arraylist of the button text on the screen, used for the animation

        • sp

          javax.swing.JScrollPane sp
          the scroll pane which contains the tasks panel. if the number of tasks on the panel are too much for the screen, a scroll bar will appear

    • Class SettingsScreen extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • timeFormat

          int timeFormat
          this integer represents which time format the user wishes to use 1 - AM/PM 2 - 24 Hour

        • tglbtnAMPMTime

          javax.swing.JToggleButton tglbtnAMPMTime
          this toggle button signifies if the user wants the time format in AM/PM

        • tglbtnHour

          javax.swing.JToggleButton tglbtnHour
          this toggle button signifies if the user wants the time format in 24 hours

        • btnResetTasks

          javax.swing.JButton btnResetTasks
          this buttons triggers the resetting of all tasks

        • btnBack

          javax.swing.JButton btnBack
          this button exits the settings screen

    • Class TaskCreator extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • textFieldTaskName

          javax.swing.JTextField textFieldTaskName
          this textfield holds the description of the task the user can type in

        • textFieldDay

          javax.swing.JTextField textFieldDay
          this textfield holds the day # the task is due the user can type in

        • textFieldDayReminder

          javax.swing.JTextField textFieldDayReminder
          this textfield holds the day # the task reminder is, that the user can type in

        • btnDone

          javax.swing.JButton btnDone
          this button triggers the compiling of the task

        • btnBack

          javax.swing.JButton btnBack
          this button exits out of this frame

        • btnNone

          javax.swing.JButton btnNone
          this button sets the priority to 0

        • btnYellow

          javax.swing.JButton btnYellow
          this button sets the priority to 1

        • btnOrange

          javax.swing.JButton btnOrange
          this button sets the priority to 2

        • btnRed

          javax.swing.JButton btnRed
          this button sets the priority to 3

        • description

          java.lang.String description
          this string holds the description of the task being created

        • date

          java.util.Date date
          this date is the due date of the task

        • reminder

          java.util.Date reminder
          this date is the time a reminder of the task will be sent out

        • priority

          int priority
          this integer represents the priority of the task, 0 being no priority, 1 being a yellow flag, 2 being an orange flag, and 3 being a red flag

        • comboBoxMonth

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxMonth
          this is the combo box showing the months

        • comboBoxYear

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxYear
          this is the combo box showing the years

        • monthArray

          java.lang.String[] monthArray
          this is an array of the months in the year the application refers to

        • yearArray

          java.lang.String[] yearArray
          this is an array of the years the application will display. it will be filled with years from the current year, to 20 years from now

        • hourArray

          java.lang.String[] hourArray
          this is an array of the hours of the day the application will display. it will change based on the time format the user selects

        • minuteArray

          java.lang.String[] minuteArray
          this is an array of the minutes of the hour the applications will display

        • task

          Task task
          this is the task object that the user will create with their input

        • comboBoxMonthReminder

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxMonthReminder
          this is the combo box to select the month for the reminder UNUSED - it is not added to the frame as the reminder feature isn't enabled

        • comboBoxHour

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxHour
          this is the combo box to select the hour for the due date

        • comboBoxMinute

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxMinute
          this is the combo box to select the minute for the due date

        • comboBoxYearReminder

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxYearReminder
          this is the combo box to select the year for the reminder UNUSED - it is not added to the frame as the reminder feature isn't enabled

        • comboBoxHourReminder

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxHourReminder
          this is the combo box to select the hour for the reminder UNUSED - it is not added to the frame as the reminder feature isn't enabled

        • comboBoxMinuteReminder

          javax.swing.JComboBox<E> comboBoxMinuteReminder
          this is the combo box to select the minute for the reminder UNUSED - it is not added to the frame as the reminder feature isn't enabled

    • Class TaskEditor extends TaskCreator implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • task

          Task task
          this is the task being edited

    • Class TaskList extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • startDate

          java.util.Date startDate
          this value holds the start of the date range for tasks the program will search for

        • endDate

          java.util.Date endDate
          this value holds the end of the date range for tasks the program will search for

        • tasks

          java.util.ArrayList<E> tasks
          this arraylist holds the tasks the panel will display

        • taskCheckBoxes

          java.util.ArrayList<E> taskCheckBoxes
          this is the arraylist of all the buttons representing checkboxes for the tasks

        • taskDescriptions

          java.util.ArrayList<E> taskDescriptions
          this is the arraylist of all the labels representing descriptions for the tasks

        • taskPriorities

          java.util.ArrayList<E> taskPriorities
          this is the arraylist of all the labels that will hold the priority flag icon for each task

        • editTaskBtn

          java.util.ArrayList<E> editTaskBtn
          this is the arraylist of all the edit buttons for each task

        • PRIORITY_ICONS

          javax.swing.ImageIcon[] PRIORITY_ICONS
          this is an array of the image icons of the different priorities
